text: is a town located in Okhotsk Subprefecture, Hokkaido, Japan. As of September 2016, the town has an estimated population of 9,268. The total area is 505.74 km². On October 1, 2009, the town of Kamiyūbetsu was merged into Yūbetsu; both are in Monbetsu District, Okhotsk Subprefecture.http://www.okhotsk.pref.hokkaido.lg.jp/ ==Sister Cities== Yūbetsu has been twinned with Whitecourt, Alberta, Canada, since 1998. ==References== ==External links== * *Official Website Category:Towns in Hokkaido
title: Yūbetsu, Hokkaido
